All javadoc 1.5 versions (Eclipse 3.1x) are affected. 
Obviously this is a javadoc bug
(http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6219854). In Suns bug
description there is workaround. Maybe it is possible to integrate this
workaround into eclipse. Otherwise javadoc cannot be run from Eclipse.

Cannot reproduce your problem using eclipse 3.1.1.

Problem seems to come from your install and not from eclipse...
Please apply workaround adviced by Sun (unset CLASSPATH environment variable)
and try again to export your javadoc from eclipse

It is working if I unset the CLASSPATH environment variable.
But a lot of users might have set the CLASSPATH variable and you don't get a
hint, why it doesn't work. 
Therefore my RFE: Eclipse should ensure that the CLASSPATH variable is not set
in the shell in which javadoc is started.

Ensuring this would require platform specific native code (different for
Windows, Unix, Mac, ...) since this can't be done using pure Java API only. 

Since there is an easy workaround (make sure the classpath doesn't point to old
JRE libraries) I opt to not add this.
